title: convert_sklearn() with CalibratedClassifierCV(base_estimator=RandomForestClassifier) raises a RuntimeError
body:
OS version: `macOS Monterey 12.0.1`
Python version: `3.7.11`

Libraries version:
```python
onnx==1.10.2
onnxconverter-common==1.8.1
onnxruntime==1.9.0
skl2onnx==1.10.0
```


Code to reproduce:
```python
from sklearn.datasets import make_classification
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.calibration import CalibratedClassifierCV

from skl2onnx import convert_sklearn
from skl2onnx.common.data_types import FloatTensorType


X, y = make_classification(n_samples=100, n_features=2, n_redundant=0, random_state=42)
base_clf = RandomForestClassifier()
calibrated_clf = CalibratedClassifierCV(base_estimator=base_clf, cv=3)
calibrated_clf.fit(X, y)

initial_type = [("float_input", FloatTensorType([None, 4]))]
onx = convert_sklearn(calibrated_clf, initial_types=initial_type)
```

Error traceback:
```python
~/.conda/envs/result-level-relevancy-poc/lib/python3.7/site-packages/skl2onnx/operator_converters/random_forest.py in convert_sklearn_random_forest_classifier(scope, operator, container, op_type, op_domain, op_version)
    192             raise RuntimeError(
    193                 "The converter cannot implement decision_function for "
--> 194                 "'{}'.".format(type(op)))
    195 
    196         input_name = operator.input_full_names

RuntimeError: The converter cannot implement decision_function for '<class 'sklearn.ensemble._forest.RandomForestClassifier'>'.
```
